questions.uddipok:
Complete the sentences using suitable clauses/phrases. The sentences are to be in the given context.
(a) As soon as the plane landed, —. (b) Even though the task was difficult, —. (c) Unless you wake up early, — (d) Because of the storm, — (e) If I were the Prime Minister, — (f) Before submitting the assignment, — (g) Although he trained hard, — (h) In spite of his illness, — (i) In order to stay healthy, — (j) I will be successful if —

sub_questions.explanation: (a) As soon as the plane landed, the passengers rushed to the exit . (b) Even though the task was difficult, she completed it on time . (c) Unless you wake up early, you will miss the bus . (d) Because of the storm, the flight was delayed for several hours . (e) If I were the Prime Minister, I would focus on improving education and healthcare . (f) Before submitting the assignment, make sure to proofread it carefully . (g) Although he trained hard, he couldn't win the competition . (h) In spite of his illness, he attended the meeting and gave his presentation . (i) In order to stay healthy, you should exercise regularly and eat balanced meals . (j) I will be successful if I stay focused and work hard towards my goals .

questions.uddipok:

The poem The Road Not Taken (a) ______ (write) by Robert Frost and first (b) ______ (publish) in 1916. It (c) ______ (tell) the story of a traveler who (d) ______ (stand) at a fork in the woods, uncertain which path to take. The poem (e) ______ (symbolize) life's choices and the impact they (f) ______ (have) on one's journey. The speaker (g) ______ (reflect) on his decision and (h) ______ (realize) that each path (i) ______ (lead) to a different destination. As the poem (j) ______ (progress), the speaker (k) ______ (acknowledge) that his choice (l) ______ (shape) his life in ways he could never predict. sub_questions.explanation: (a) was written; (b) published; (c) tells; (d) stands; (e) symbolizes; (f) have; (g) reflects; (h) realizes; (i) leads; (j) progresses; (k) acknowledges; (l) shaped; (m) remains; (n) is.

questions.uddipok:
Change the narrative style by using indirect speeches.
He said, "We must fight to protect our freedom." She told him,"I hope for peace in our lifetime." The general said, "Prepare the troops for battle." He said, "I fear the consequences of this war." She asked, "Do you think there is a way to end this conflict?" He said, "The war will end only when both sides agree to peace." She said, "I can't bear to see the destruction caused by the war."

sub_questions.explanation: He said that they had to fight to protect their freedom. She told him that she hoped for peace in their lifetime. The general ordered him to prepare the troops for battle. He said that he feared the consequences of the war. She asked if he thought there was a way to end the conflict. He replied that the war would end only when both sides agreed to peace. Hearing that, she said that she couldn't bear to see the destruction caused by the war.

questions.uddipok: Suppose you are Pantho, studying in class XII in Jhenaidah Cadet College. Your class is interested to organize a Career Fair in your college. For this, you need to submit an application to the principal of your college suggesting top ten job preferences as your class is going to set ten different stalls in the fair. Now, write an application to your principal for the approval and necessary administrative supports for arranging the Career Fair for the students of local colleges.

sub_questions.explanation:
03 March 2025
The Principal
Jhenaidah Cadet College
Jhenaidah
Subject: Application for approval and support to organize a career fair
Dear Sir,
We, the students of Class XII, would like to organize a Career Fair at our college for the students of local colleges. The fair. will help students learn about different career options and plan for the future. We plan to set up ten stalls, each representing different professions. The professions are as follows: Doctor, Engineer, Teacher, Banker, Army Officer, Software Developer, Entrepreneur, Journalist, Government Officer and Researcher.
We request your approval and necessary administrative support for organizing this event. We also need permission to invite guest speakers from different fields. We believe this fair will inspire students and help them choose the right career path.
We, therefore, hope that you would kindly approve and provide necessary administrative supports for arranging the Career Fair and oblige.
Sincerely yours.
Pantho Sarker
Class: XII, Section: B
On behalf of the students of Class XII of Jhenaidah Cadet College

questions.uddipok: Suppose your college had a refreshing and entertaining annual picnic recently in a theme park. Now, write a application ?

sub_questions.explanation:
Our Annual College Picnic

Our annual college picnic was a fun and refreshing event. Last week. we visited Fancy World, a theme park full of exciting rides. Early in the morning, we gathered at our college and started our journey by bus. There were almost 300 students, and fifteen teachers accompanied us. The journey was enjoyable as we sang songs, laughed, and admired the scenic views along the way. When we reached the park, we were amazed by its colorful rides, green gardens, and a big lake. We first explored the park and took many pictures. Then, we went on different rides like roller coasters and bumper cars. The water park was the most exiciting part. We played in the water and had a lot of fun. At lunchtime, we sat together and enjoyed a delicious meal. After lunch, we played group games. The whole day was filled with laughter and joy. In the evening, we took a final walk around the park and then started our return journey. We returned home feeling happy and refreshed, carrying many wonderful memories. It was truly an amazing picnic, and we will cherish the moments forever.

questions.uddipok: Write a cause and effect paragraph in 200 words on 'Unemployment Problem in Our Country',

sub_questions.explanation:
Unemployment Problem in Our Country

When a man has a job or a work for his living, he is employed. And when he has no job, he is referred as unemployed. In a country, if there are more able people than the total number of jobs, there is an unemployment problem. Bangladesh is now seriously facing this problem. An unemployed person is generally either frustrated or an idle brain. Moreover, when they are not in any service, they hardly care anyone. There is a popular saying, "An idle brain is the devil's workshop." Nowadays, the social disorder is mainly caused by unemployment. Hence, it is a great curse in our country.We can, however, change our condition by ourselves. The first thing that can be done is to control the high birth rate of our population. We all desire to work in cities. This tendency should be changed. We can engage ourselves in self-employment in our rural areas. In this context, the government should help the unemployed people with technical education and financial support. The government should increase facilities in the field of technology. Moreover, the guardians of the society can help their children most. They can help them with good advice and guidance.
